Event.name: Going_back_on_a_commitment
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Protagonist</fen> has made a <fen>Commitment</fen> but does not honor it, thereby doing harm to an <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">My buddy Tom's girlfriend</fex> <t>backed out</t> <fex name="Commitment">of going to the show with me</fex>.</ex>
<ex>However, <fex name="pro">the employer</fex> <fex name="Time">then</fex> <t>backed out</t> <fex name="Commitment">of that statement</fex> and did not pay the STD!</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Protagonist">The government</fex> had <t>reneged</t> <fex name="Commitment">on promises to give them land</fex>.</ex>
<ex>When <fex name="pro">she and her family</fex> <t>went back</t> <fex name="com">on their police statement</fex> <fex name="pla">in the Vadodara court</fex> <fex name="Time">in May 2003</fex>, it stirred a huge controversy.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Protagonist
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen> is the person who has committed themselves to do something and later does not follow through on it.
<ex>The human rights situation is infinitely better now than under the Taliban, but <fex name="pro">the Bush administration</fex> has <t>reneged</t> on its pledge of a new Marshall Plan.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Affected_party
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group to whom the <fen>Protagonist</fen> had made the <fen>Commitment</fen> and who is negatively affected by the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s not honoring the <fen>Commitment</fen>.
<ex>Two people <t>backed out</t> <fex name="aff">on me</fex> a few days earlier.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Commitment
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An expression of the commitment that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> has taken on earlier and which they fail to follow through on.
<ex>It appears that Schwarzenegger will <t>renege</t> <fex name="com">on an agreement he made with teachers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>).It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Protagonist that also affect the action (<ment>coldly</ment>).
<ex>They <fex name="man">deliberately</fex> <t>backed out</t> of Government last November because they knew that the 'hard men' were not ready for it.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> fails to honor their commitment.
<ex>When a host city <t>backed out</t> <fex name="Time">at the last minute</fex> and Russellville, Ark., landed the opportunity to host the Babe Ruth 16-Year-Old World Series.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> fails to honor the commitment they made.
<ex>But his efforts came to nought when 18 of the 19 accused were bailed out as most witnesses <t>backed out</t> <fex name="pla">in court</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s failure to honor the <fen>Commitment</fen> logically follows.
<ex>The buyer <t>backed out</t> <fex name="exp">because the seller asked for more money</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition:
<def-root> In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s act of going back on their <fen>Commitment</fen> as a whole.
<ex>When Roy Jones <fex name="eve">cowardly</fex> <t>backed out</t> of a fight with Heavyweight Buster Douglas, Toney again offered himself as a replacement.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>How much the <fen>Protagonist</fen> goes back on their <fen>Commitment</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re_encoding, but not necessarily.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fen>Iterations</fen> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times the <fen>Protagonist</fen> backed out on a commitment.</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The outcome of the Protagonist going back on a commitment.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: renege.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go back on a promise, undertaking, or contract.
